title: Issue 303
summary: MAUI goodness and oh so many videos and podcasts.

items.description:
Happy weekend everyone, you made it!

There has been quite a bit of MAUI goodness going on with the release of Preview 3, so quite a bit in this weeks edition... And oh so many videos and podcasts.

Thanks to Vijay and Vadim for submitting some additional articles this week.

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:
Happy weekend everyone, you made it!

There has been quite a bit of MAUI goodness going on with the release of Preview 3, so quite a bit in this weeks edition... And oh so many videos and podcasts.

Thanks to Vijay and Vadim for submitting some additional articles this week.

❤

Kym

items.title: Getting started with CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Leomaris gives an introduction to the CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms. All the essential properties events and commands are covered.

Getting started with CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Leomaris gives an introduction to the CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms.  All the essential properties events and commands are covered.

[**Getting started with CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms**](https://blog.logrocket.com/getting-started-with-collectionview-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://twitter.com/leomarisreyes11)

items.title: Paywall Screens
items.description:
Everything you need to design top-notch mobile paywall screens. View examples of other apps and use a Figma template to quickly design your own.

items.title: The Current State of Mobile UX (18 Common Pitfalls)
items.description:
This article analyzes the current state of mobile UX, and outline 18 common design pitfalls and strategic oversights applicable to most mobile e-commerce sites.

items.title: EBind - Binding Framework
items.description:
I haven't delved into this too much but looks like a interesting Binding framework - or as the project says: .NET Data Binding we deserve: concise, fast, feature-rich.

items.title: Free Xamarin UI Controls for Android & iOS
items.description:
Registered DevExpress.com users are entitled to a free copy of DevExpress Xamarin.Forms Controls v20.2. A control suite for Xamarin.Forms ships with several user interface components. Includes a Data Grid, Scheduler, Charts, Tab View and Navigation Drawer.

Free Xamarin UI Controls for Android & iOS - C# | DevExpress by DevExpress
items.description_markdown:
Registered DevExpress.com users are entitled to a free copy of DevExpress Xamarin.Forms Controls v20.2. A control suite for Xamarin.Forms ships with several user interface components. Includes a Data Grid, Scheduler, Charts, Tab View and Navigation Drawer.

[**Free Xamarin UI Controls for Android & iOS - C# | DevExpress**](https://www.devexpress.com/xamarin/free-offer/) by [DevExpress](https://www.devexpress.com/)

embedded_links.title: **Free Xamarin UI Controls for Android & iOS - C# | DevExpress**

items.title: GitExplorer
items.description:
Not specifically Xamarin, but super useful if you are not great with git command line - GitExplorer: Find the right git commands you need without digging through the web

GitExplorer by Summitech

Not specifically Xamarin, but super useful if you are not great with git command line - GitExplorer: Find the right git commands you need without digging through the web

items.title: RunSafe Tasks / Commands wrapper in Xamarin
items.description:
When we work with Task most of the time we do common implementations of scenarios where we use repetitive code. For example use IsBusy, try-catch, Logging, etc. The idea is to make a wrapper that allows us to store all this logic for us to reuse.

RunSafe Tasks / Commands wrapper in Xamarin by Luis Matos
items.description_markdown:
When we work with Task most of the time we do common implementations of scenarios where we use repetitive code. For example use IsBusy, try-catch, Logging, etc.  The idea is to make a wrapper that allows us to store all this logic for us to reuse.

[**RunSafe Tasks / Commands wrapper in Xamarin**](https://luismts.com/runsafe-tasks-commands-wrapper/) by [Luis Matos](https://twitter.com/luismatosluna)

items.title: Workaround to force Xamarin.Forms WebView to use a dark mode CSS for local content on Android
items.description:
As the 'prefer-color-scheme'-CSS query does not work on Android with a Xamarin.Forms WebView, I needed find a workaround to support dark mode for local HTML content. In this post, I'll show you a Xamarin.Forms only workaround.

Workaround to force Xamarin.Forms WebView to use a dark mode CSS for local content on Android by Marco Siccardi
items.description_markdown:
As the 'prefer-color-scheme'-CSS query does not work on Android with a Xamarin.Forms WebView, I needed find a workaround to support dark mode for local HTML content. In this post, I'll show you a Xamarin.Forms only workaround.

[**Workaround to force Xamarin.Forms WebView to use a dark mode CSS for local content on Android**](https://msicc.net/workaround-to-force-xamarin-forms-webview-to-use-a-dark-mode-css-for-local-content-on-android/) by [Marco Siccardi](https://twitter.com/msicc)

embedded_links.title: **Workaround to force Xamarin.Forms WebView to use a dark mode CSS for local content on Android**

items.title: Xamarin.Forms Shell Navigation 101
items.description:
It is time to finally take a look at navigation with Xamarin.Forms Shell! This new type of navigation enables URL based navigation similar to how you would navigate in the browser. This means you setup routes, pass parameters to set data, and even navigate back all by passing a string. In this video I show you all the good parts for what you need to know.

Xamarin.Forms Shell Navigation 101 by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
It is time to finally take a look at navigation with Xamarin.Forms Shell! This new type of navigation enables URL based navigation similar to how you would navigate in the browser. This means you setup routes, pass parameters to set data, and even navigate back all by passing a string. In this video I show you all the good parts for what you need to know.

[**Xamarin.Forms Shell Navigation 101**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8iYpLMKE_ws) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

items.title: Shadows Everywhere in Your Xamarin.Forms App
items.description:
Shadows can really enrich your UI design. In the Xamarin Community Toolkit there is now the ShadowEffect. With this attached property you can apply shadows, with some customizations, to any element on your screen. In this video we will learn how.

Shadows Everywhere in Your Xamarin.Forms App by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Shadows can really enrich your UI design. In the Xamarin Community Toolkit there is now the ShadowEffect. With this attached property you can apply shadows, with some customizations, to any element on your screen. In this video we will learn how.

[**Shadows Everywhere in Your Xamarin.Forms App**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=enCimiMmm3Q) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

items.title: The Xamarin Show: XAML Hot Reload Updates
items.description:
This week, James is joined by Dmitry Lyalin and Tim Miller who show off the latest and greatest in XAML Hot Reload technology with the new "changes only" mode that saves the state of your running application! Check it out!

XAML Hot Reload Updates | Xamarin Show by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
This week, James is joined by Dmitry Lyalin and Tim Miller who show off the latest and greatest in XAML Hot Reload technology with the new "changes only" mode that saves the state of your running application! Check it out!

[**XAML Hot Reload Updates | Xamarin Show**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/XAML-Hot-Reload-Updates--Xamarin-Show) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

items.title: The Xamarin Show - App Localization (Xamarin Community Toolkit)
items.description:
To make inclusive apps, localization might be a good idea. To help you with that, we have got a couple of things in the Xamarin Community Toolkit that you can use. In this episode I have Maksym on the show who will tell us about the LocalizationManager and shows us how to quickly and easily localize you Xamarin.Forms app

App Localization (Xamarin Community Toolkit) by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
To make inclusive apps, localization might be a good idea. To help you with that, we have got a couple of things in the Xamarin Community Toolkit that you can use. In this episode I have Maksym on the show who will tell us about the LocalizationManager and shows us how to quickly and easily localize you Xamarin.Forms app

[**App Localization (Xamarin Community Toolkit)**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/App-Localization-Xamarin-Community) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

items.description:
Everyone loves the Android emulator right? Regardless if you are a pro Android dev or just getting started I am here to break down all the tips and tricks needed to make the best use of the emulator.

Android Emulator Tips & Tricks | Always on Top, Hyper-V Support, Geolocation, & More by James Montemagno

items.title: Null Pointers 47: Object Relational Mappers (ORMs)
items.description:
Tune in while we talk all about object relational mappers. OK, mostly Entity Framework because of the .NET developers we are. But also we touch on Dapper, document databases, our migration nightmares and even Steven and Gerald's mothers. Now if that doesn't convince you to listen I don't know what will!

47: Object Relational Mappers (ORMs) by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
Tune in while we talk all about object relational mappers. OK, mostly Entity Framework because of the .NET developers we are. But also we touch on Dapper, document databases, our migration nightmares and even Steven and Gerald's mothers. Now if that doesn't convince you to listen I don't know what will!

[**47: Object Relational Mappers (ORMs)**](https://nullpointers.io/47/) by [Null Pointers](https://nullpointers.io/)
